item.title: deploying searchblox manual process
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Deploying searchblox (manual process)

Revision History:
    2016-11-02 12:26:03 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

CI:
- https://stage-searchblox-index.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/admin/main.jsp
- https://stage-searchblox-search-01.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/admin/main.jsp
- https://stage-searchblox-search-02.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/admin/main.jsp

What HHS Deems the "UI"s. The only thing that is important here is that the URL points to an ALB consisting of a target group of 3 servers. The path to each 'UI' is handled by the Searchblox application:
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/hhs/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/stopbullying/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/vaccines/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/oah/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/oash/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/oig/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/opa/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/hrsa/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/ocr/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/hhs_news/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/hhs_dab/index.html
- https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/ihs_intranet/index.html 


Deploying searchblox

Prerequisites:
- There will be 1 cluster, consisting of 1 index server and 2 search servers. The same AMI will be used for these 3 servers.
- The application is installed in /opt
- Userdata exists to manage the /home, /var/log, /var/tmp, and /appdata partitions. This takes care of some of the compliance but we'll need to do a bit more. (eg creating an app-specific user, etc).


1) create 3 servers from the supplied AMI, and name them as 1 index & 2 search servers
- Currently the AMI ID is ami-05fec7d928333b846
- instance size for all 3 servers is r5.xlarge
- servers need to be in public subnet
- each server needs an Elastic IP assigned
Note: Do not release this Elastic IP - licensing will depend on this.
- Use the existing EC2 keypair: hhs-searchblox-stg-v1 (for stage). or create one for prod. Remember to put this in 1P



*** Note: Steps 2 through 7 need to be done on each server ***
2a) hosts file and hostname file
- modify /etc/hosts file
Ensure the following lines:
127.0.0.1 localhost <Elastic IP Address>
127.0.1.1 <Elastic IP Address>

- modify /etc/hostname file:
replace the contents with <Elastic IP Address>

- run this command, an substitute the ip address accordingly:
hostname <Elastic IP Address>


2b) To get the Searchblox application to run using it's Elastic IP, Elasticsearch file needs some changes. Modify /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/WEB-INF/elasticsearch.yml file and update the following:
*** change network.host to the local(private) ip adddress ***
*** change network.publish_host to the public IP address ***

root@54:/opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/WEB-INF# cat elasticsearch.yml
cluster.name: searchblox
node.name: sb_node_54_89_91_54
indices.fielddata.cache.size: 40%
http.enabled: true
elasticfence.disabled: false
elasticfence.root.password: searchblox
index.refresh_interval: 4s
searchblox.shards: 1
searchblox.replica: 0
searchblox.master: 54.89.91.54
network.host: <*** change network.host to the local(private) ip adddress ***>
network.publish_host: <*** change network.publish_host to the public IP address ***>
discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts: [54.89.91.54,18.204.171.245,34.197.28.78]


3) Configure cluster
In the UI > login > Admin > Cluster
Add the servers of index & search (specify public IPs)
The IP address for the cluster shoudl match discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts in elasticsearch.yml

Default passwords:
User: admin
password: 1p

4) apply license
In the UI > login > Admin > License (Licenses can be found in 1P)


5) Stop the searchblox app
ssh into each server > service searchblox stop

6) change the elasticsearch.yml file (if not already done)
*** network.host should be the local(private) ip adddress ***
*** add network.publish_host should be the public IP address ***

7a) delete old index data (On a new build this is not necessary)
- delete /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/index (on all 3 servers)

7b) start searchblox app (Index server first. then start both of the search servers. When you see "Searchblox has been started" in the status.log of the Index server, start searchblox on the search servers. Though I have not experienced issues with starting the search servers a few minutes after the index server starts).
ssh > service searchblox start
and tail /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/logs/status.log for the status.

9) create a test Collection on the index server. Confirm that the Collection is replicated to the search servers.
log into UI > Collections > Create

10) Start indexing
Click the Index button on each item to start indexing

11) Upload searchblox_ads.csv (not necessary unless Strategic says to do so)
Log into Admin UI > Search > Featured Results > Import > select searchblox_ads.csv > Upload
Then change Featured Results List per page to 1000, and confirm 1804 results on page 2


Notes:
Userdata has been updated to add LVM for /var/log, /tmp, /home. This was not provided by Strategic
Userdata makes some modifications to /etc/hosts file. I do not believe this is compliant with hostnames, but these are the instructions that were provided to me.
Userdata currently installs splunk, and sets up most of the log forwarding...at least i believe it does
- You will need to modify /opt/splunkforwarder/etc/system/local/inputs.conf and change to FQDN. I'll figure something out for this one.

- Need to configure sensu (still outstanding)
- add monitoring of the UI's.
- These 3 URLs are in proxy-01.prod.hhs.local:
- https://stage-searchblox-index.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/admin/main.jsp
- https://stage-searchblox-search-01.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/admin/main.jsp
- https://stage-searchblox-search-02.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/admin/main.jsp



15-Jan 2019:
- For Steps 2 & 3. I confirmed with Searchblox that if you update elasticsearch.yml file before starting searchblox application, you can skip this because the elasticsearc.yml will essentially create the cluster for you
- For Step 4 - if you replace the supplied license file with /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/WEB-INF/license.yml, you can skip this step because that will take care of licensing
- For step 10 - there is a way to use the Rest API to kick off indexing. 
- Still to do: configure indexing on a regular schedule
- Still to do: documentation on backup process of indexed data. This is in addition to snapshots.```

item.title: HHS Add new ruby version
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Add a new ruby version for rails app use

Revision History:
    2016-04-25 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
 - deploy.cloud.hhs.gov

Steps:
- ssh into puppetmaster.svcs.hhs.local
- switch to the root user
sudo su
- edit the manifest in question for the server that serves the application
 Uncomment the following lines and replace the ruby version with the desired version

#    rvm::ruby { "deploy":
#        user => "deploy",
#        version => "ruby-2.2.3"
#    }

- on the application server run puppet agent -t
- return to the puppetmaster and comment out the above lines again.


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: HHS AMS ldap user sync
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: ADDE upgrade

Revision History:
    2017-08-22 14:16:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

This is just an informative KB about the history of the LDAP sync script.

Links:

CI:
 - dns-02.svcs.hhs.local (ldap-01.svcs.hhs.local)
 - dns-01.svcs.hhs.local (ldap-02.svcs.hhs.local)
 - evd.hhs.gov (158.74.36.40). Port 636

- Prerequisites
N/A

- Details
You can find the ldap sync scripts on dns-02.svcs.hhs.local:/appdaata/test. To run the sync, issue the following command:
java -cp . AMSPullNoCert  > users.txt

- Schedule
The script is run manually every Friday night.



Sample queries against the HHS LDAP:
ldapsearch -H ldaps://158.74.36.40:636  -b ou=hhsusers,ou=HHS,dc=eim,dc=hhsidentity,dc=hhs,dc=gov -D cn=WCDPortal,ou=People,dc=lsa1,dc=gov -w 'HH$julyRelease!@' sn=arjumand




=================================================

item.title: hhs confluence add user
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Confluence: add new user

Revision History:
    2018-07-27 13:44:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

CI:
 - wiki.cloud.hhs.gov
 - stage-wiki.cloud.hhs.gov

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Adding account to confluence
1-Search for the account in ldap.
2- If the account is found and it is not Posix deleted 
3- If not there or deleted create the account, make sure to note the password to be sent to the user.
4- Make sure the created account has the Employee ID set.
5 - Add the account to cn=wiki-users,ou=groups,dc=hhs,dc=local group.
6 - Log in to https://wiki.cloud.hhs.gov
7- Go to Settings > General Configuration > User Directories.
8 - Synchronise
9 - Make sure the user is in the directory. 

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: hhs confluence upgrade apply ams steps
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Confluence upgrade: Applying AMS afterwards

Revision History:
    2019-04-26 16:15:58 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduct, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


Confluence 3.0+:

Installation is much the same for Confluence.

Install:
- Copy the OpenAM client sdk to atlassian-confluence/WEB-INF/lib/
- Create/copy an AMConfig.properties to atlassian-confluence/WEB-INF/classes/ (or somewhere in the classpath)
- Copy this projects jar to atlassian-confluence/WEB-INF/lib/

- edit atlassian-confluence/WEB-INF/classes/seraph-config.xml:

Update the login.url, link.login.url and logout.url parameters as before.

Comment out this line.

<!--  <authenticator class="com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceAuthenticator"/>  -->

replace with this:

<authenticator class="com.sun.identity.provider.seraph.OpenSsoConfluenceAuthenticator"/>

You will need to restart Confluence for changes to take effect.

- Use com.sun.identity.provider.seraph.OpenSsoConfluenceAuthenticator
- Thanks to Casey.BUTTERWORTH at suncorp.com.au
 * https://opensso.dev.java.net/servlets/ReadMsg?listName=users&msgNo=11574

Build:
- Use maven 2.x


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: HHS deque analysis 01 tmp partition filling
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Deque analysis server /tmp partition filling

Revision History:
    2017-10-05 22:14:08 - Version 1 created by Bao


Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Prerequisites:
- None

CI:
- hhs-deque-analysis-01.prod.hhs.local

Overview:
In brief, Deque is buggy at best. The application writes temp files to /tmp but doesn’t clean up after itself. This is a known issue with Deque version 6. Let’s pray it’s fixed in version 7.

Steps to fix:
- ssh to hhs-deque-analysis—01.prod.hhs.local
- do a df -h to confirm that it is the /tmp partition filling
- cd /tmp
- do an 
ls -l
- If you see a Downloads folder, this is safe to remove. It will probably solve your problems, but just in case, you might need to continue to the next step in this kb.
- Then do an
ls -ldtr .com.google* | head -10
- You will notice a lot of hidden files that start with .com or .something-else. 
- Anything older than 8 hours can be removed. So you can perform something like this command. Just make sure that the oldest 10000 directories is older than 8 hours:
ls -ldtr .com.google* | head -10000 | awk '{print $9}' | xargs rm -rf
- Then repeat until you have enough disk space reclaimed.




=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: hhs deque info
item.description:
<pre tabindex="0"><code>Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation) =================================================
Subject: Deque Information
Revision History: 2015-03-02 09:52:41 - Version 1 created by Bao 2017-01-16 9:44:51 - Version 1.b Updated for Deque 6.1.4 2018-09-25 11:55:13 - Version 2 added LDAP settings info
Assets: - hhs-deque-core-01.prod.hhs.local (m4.xlarge) - hhs-deque-analysis-01.prod.hhs.local (m4.xlarge) - RDS
UI Login - hhs-deque-core-01.prod.hhs.local/auth - hhs-deque-core-01.prod.hhs.local/worldspace (LDAP)
Current Deque version: 6.1.4
Prerequisites - Packages that need to be installed on the core server: supervisor rabbitmq After rabbitmq is installed, run the following commands (substitute the password as necessary) rabbitmqctl add_vhost / rabbitmqctl add_user dqadmin admin rabbitmqctl set_user_tags dqadmin administrator rabbitmqctl set_permissions -p / dqadmin ".*" ".*" ".*" Redis Redis vulnerability: in /etc/redis/redis.conf, in the requirepass directive, add a password in Deque: cd /appdata/deque/mounts/config-server vi application.yml in the redis section add the following: password: <<<< password from above >>>
Mongo in /etc/mongo.conf, ensure the following is enabled: security: authorization: enabled Mongo password: mongodb://username:password@hhs-deque-core-01.stg.hhs.local:27018/deque Also need to run some mongo commands to create users and databases (be careful of the copy/paste of quotes/backticks) mongo admin --port 27018 --eval "db.createUser({ user: 'mongodeque', pwd: 'Hw6wmaPF2jhqkWDob', roles: [ { role: 'dbOwner', db: 'admin' } ] });" mongo deque --port 27018 --eval "db.createUser({ user: 'mongodeque', pwd: 'Hw6wmaPF2jhqkWDob', roles: [ { role: 'dbOwner', db: 'deque' } ] });" mongo deque-custom-rules --port 27018 --eval "db.createUser({ user: 'mongodeque', pwd: 'Hw6wmaPF2jhqkWDob', roles: [ { role: 'dbOwner', db:'deque-custom-rules' } ] });"
****** TO DO:::: - find out why mongo is not starting using the service. ****** - Packages that need to be installed on the analysis server supervisor Chrome wget -q -O - https://dl-ssl.google.com/linux/linux_signing_key.pub | sudo apt-key add - echo "deb [arch=amd64] http://dl.google.com/linux/chrome/deb/ stable main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-chrome.list apt-get update apt-get install -y google-chrome-stable XVFB apt-get install -y libgtk-3-dev xvfb
- Ports that need to be open from analysis server to core server: 5672 (rabbitmq) 6379 (redis) 8095 (deque application port) 8761 (deque application port) 15672 (rabbitmq admin) 27018 (mongo make sure to point the datadir to /appdata/mongo)
- installer (this is the deque *.run file) - RDS (if you go MySQL, make sure that you configure the datadir to /appdata/mysql) create 2 databases: wscomply wauth create 1 user with access to both databases
============================================================================================================ Running processes on each Deque server. These processes are handled by supervisor ============================================================================================================ Core server - LoadController - TaskProcessor - BrowserHub - DocumentProcessor - WorldspaceComply - WSAuth - WSWeb (Nginx)
Analysis server - BrowserService - WSMgrService
Log files /appdata/deque/logs /appdata/deque/tomcat/logs *Logs must be cleared manually.
============================================================================================================ Contacting Deque support Send an email to: help@deque.com Allowed users to contact Deque support: bnguyen, ktzeng, Alex(HHS), possibly 1 or 2 others. In the email include - description of the problem - version of worldspace (currently 6.1.4 ============================================================================================================
Normal order of start process: - Core Server - WSWeb - WSAuth - WorldspaceComply (Pause and wait until UI is up) - BrowserHub - BrowserService To verify processes have started you can tail BrowserService.log and see where it says ‘connected to hub’ - TaskProcessor Tail BrowserService.log and check for ‘firefox running’ message. - DocumentProcessor - LoadController - WSMgrService
============================================================================================================ Troubleshooting ============================================================================================================
If a user reports that the scans appear to be running but not ‘moving’: Stop scanning services in the following order: - LoadController - TaskProcessor - BrowserHub - BrowserService
Then start scanning services in the following order: - BrowserHub - BrowserService - TaskProcessor - DocumentProcessor - LoadController
- mongo disk space on hhs-deque-core-01.prod.hhs.local Mongo database only keeps cached data. This can be dropped at any time. Drop the database with the following command (can be cron'd as necessary): /usr/bin/mongo deque --port 27018 --eval "db.dropDatabase()"
- logrotate for /appdata/deque/log in /appdata/deque/supervisord edit: comply.conf add: stdout_logfile_backups=x
then run: (when you run the update command, there's a chance that it'll restart the services, so schedule accordingly) supervisorctl reread supervisorctl update
- uninstalling deque to uninstall deque go into cd /appdata/deque and run the uninstall script. THen remove the contents of /appdata/deque/*
- How to stop all running scans from the database 1) MySQL queries DELETE FROM wscomply.work_queue_item; UPDATE wscomply.spider_job SET location = null, status = 'Completed'; UPDATE wscomply.issue SET marked_for_deletion = 0; 2) Rabbitmq Also need to clear the rabbitmq queues. - stop rabbitmq service (/etc/init.d/rabbitmq-server stop) - remove contents of /appdata/rabbitmq/mnesia/<hostname>/ - restart rabbitmq service - rerun the rabbitmqctl commands to create the user: rabbitmqctl add_user dqadmin deque && rabbitmqctl set_user_tags dqadmin administrator && rabbitmqctl set_permissions -p / dqadmin ".*" ".*" ".*" - enable the plugins again sudo rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_management
- Troubleshooting connections to Database The database connection strings are stored in /appdata/deque/tmocat/comm/classes/WorldSpaceConfig.groovy
- Enabling debug: Change 2 files: /appdata/deque/mounts/config-server
- Enabling LDAP (ensuring LDAP is used) vi /appdata/deque/mounts/config-server/worldspace-core/production/application.yml Change: useldap=false to: useldap=true
- Assigning a user as an administrator 1. Connect to the worldspace mysql server, and select the appropriate database. use DATABASE_NAME;
Example: use wscomply;
2.Find the User ID of the user in question. select id,username,email from fireeyesuser whereemail='user_email@domain';
+----+---------------------------------+-----------------------------------+ | id | username | email | +----+---------------------------------+-----------------------------------+ | 7 |user_email@domain |user_email@domain | +----+---------------------------------+-----------------------------------+ A sample user ID
3. Set the user as an administrator, where N in the following query is the user's ID. INSERT INTO role_people VALUES((SELECT id FROM role WHERE authority='ROLE_ADMIN'), N);
- To remove admin privileges from a user, use UPDATE role_people SET role_id=(SELECT id FROM role WHERE authority='ROLE_USER') WHERE role_id = (select id from role where authority = 'ROLE_ADMIN') AND user_id=N; - Mass add a user account to all projects as admin INSERT INTO fireeyesgroup_fireeyesuser (group_users_id, user_id) SELECT DISTINCT fg.id, (SELECT id FROM fireeyesuser WHERE email='email@domain') FROM fireeyesgroup fg WHERE fg.name='admins';
Updating DNS for Deque - Keycloak In Keycloak, append DNS to comply section > clients
- hhs-deque-core-01.prod.hhs.local - in deque/common/classes directory - Edit WorldSpace_config.groovy -> confirm https & URL change - Edit keycloak.json file -> confirm https://... URL - deque/components/web/conf.d/* remove deque-specific ssl cert references
- Mongo issues if mongo is failing tail the manager.log: /appdata/deque/logs/manager.log
============================================================================================================ Deque UI Login (need to port to 1password ============================================================================================================ URL: https://deque1.cloud.hhs.gov/keycloak admin@deque.com admin
============================================================================================================ Installation issues and workarounds ============================================================================================================ on analysis server, make sure the following is running:
/usr/bin/Xvfb :6 -ac -screen 0 1024x768x16 -fbdir /tmp/ /usr/bin/xterm -display :6 -e ./runBrowserService.sh
- On the analysis server, the installer expects that nginx be installed, even though it only runs on the core server. The directory for nginx may not exist. The installer will eventually timeout. It's probably a good idea to mkdir -p /etc/nginx as a blank directory.
—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————— (Deprecated - Firefox is no longer used - chrome is the package that you want to install) Firefox package version (dpkg -l | grep firefox) - need to ensure version 45.5.1
============================================================================================================ The /appdata/deque/bin directory ============================================================================================================ This directory is, well, the bin directory.
db_upgrade.sh is often run after an install. first_run.sh is run only on a fresh install.
============================================================================================================ Overview of Installation ============================================================================================================
1) download the deque installer (both analysis and core server) https://sftp.dequecloud.com/?u=SgNG&p=y72f&path=/comply.linux-6.1.4.run
2) mongo.conf (core server) change bindIP to listen on 0.0.0.0 change dbPath....Note If you change this, be sure to make the directory Changed default port from 27017 to 270178
3) redis.conf change bind value to IP or 0.0.0.0. (core server)
4) RabbitMQ (core server) enable plugins: rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_management rabbitmqctl add_user {username} {password} && rabbitmqctl set_user_tags {username} administrator && rabbitmqctl set_permissions -p / {username} ".*" ".*" ".*"
5) Chrome vs firefox (install chrome on the analysis server) 1.) Import the public key used by the package management system: wget -q -O - https://dl-ssl.google.com/linux/linux_signing_key.pub | sudo apt-key add - 2.) Create the list file for RabbitMQ: echo "deb [arch=amd64] http://dl.google.com/linux/chrome/deb/ stable main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-chrome.list 3.) Reload the local package database: sudo apt-get update 4.) Install the Google Chrome packages: sudo apt-get install -y google-chrome-stable
6) xvfb & GTk3 (core & analysis servers) apt-get update apt-get install -y libgtk-3-dev xvfb
7 set up the database cd /appdata/deque/bin/ ./db_upgrade.sh
8. cd /appdata/deque/components/keycloak/standalone/configuration vi standalone.xml change <connection-url> to localhost </connection-url>
9. cd /appdata/deque/components/bin ./firstrun.sh (only run on new installs)
CTRL+C to kill the script this script creates tables and users in the auth database. It is only necessary to run once during the install.
10. cd /appdata/deque/mounts/config-server/worldspace-core/production/ vi application.yml file This is the database connection string. change the jdbc hostname line to 'localhost'
11. cd /appdata/deque/mounts/nginx/conf.d vi comply.conf
in the serverline remove http://
restart nginx
12. chown worldspace:worldspace /appdata/deque -R
on the core server: 13. supervisorctl status 14. supervisorctl stop all 15. supervisorctl start scan-manager:ecp-registry & tail /appdata/deque/logs/registry.log 16. supervisorctl start scan-manager:ecp-config-server & tail /appdata/deque/logs/config-server.log 17. supervisorctl start scan-manager: & tail /appdata/deque/logs/custom-rules.log 18. supervisorctl start worldspace: & tail /appdata/deque/logs/keycloak.log 19. tail worldspace-core.log
on the analysis server supervisorctl status supervisorctl stop all supervisorctl start scan-worker:
20. cd /appdata/deque/supervisord/ (on the analysis server) vi comply.conf --change autostart to false for the following: program:ecp-registry, and ecp-config-server----
[program:ecp-registry] command=/appdata/deque/components/java/bin/java -jar /appdata/deque/components/comply/wars/registry-1.1.3.war -Xmx1024m -Xms256m -Djava.security.egd=file:/dev/./urandom --spring.profiles.active=production -XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError directory=/appdata/deque autostart=false
[program:ecp-config-server] command=/appdata/deque/components/java/bin/java -jar /appdata/deque/components/comply/wars/config-server-1.1.3.war -Xmx1024m -Xms256m -Djava.security.egd=file:/dev/./urandom --eureka.client.serviceUrl.defaultZone=http://hhs-deque-core-01.stg.hhs.local:8761/eureka --spring.profiles.active=native -XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError directory=/appdata/deque autostart=false
21. supervisorctl start scan-worker: (on the analysis server) 22. tail -f /appdata/deque/logs/worker.log (and make sure there are no errors in the log)
23. UI Work - load the core server in a browser (hhs-deque-core-01.stg.hhs.local/auth) default user/password is admin/admin
go to Clients go to Comply
in the Valid reirects URIs remove anything with worlspace-core, localhost, 127., etc. should only have 2 urls with stage-deque1.cloud.hhs.gov, and then add URLs for FQDN of the core server(eg: http://hhs-deque-core-01.stg.hhs.local/* and https://hhs-deque-core-01.stg.hhs.local/*)
=================== Troubleshooting why the DNS doens't load. Suspect something with the Apache reverse proxy but configuration works in prod =================== /appdata/deque/mounts/config-server/realm/worldspace-comply/master change keycloak.json DNS to FQDN of the server
/appdata/deque/mounts/config-server/worldspace-core/production/ change application.yml DNS to FQDN of the server feServerBaseUrl: http://hhs-deque-core-01.stg.hhs.local/worldspace
*** NOTE: Do not start the worldspace comply service until the config-server service has fully started
24. in the UI: log in with admin@deque.com, admin. go to system settings go to organizations create a test Organization
==================================================================================== troubleshooting nginx
/appdata/deque/mounts/config-server/worldspace-core/production/ vi application.xml scroll to the bottom and change http://stage-deque1.cloud.hhs.gov to http://FQDN of the server which didn't work so we changed this line from 80 to 443 (ie https://stage-deque1.cloud.hhs.gov)
Add'l troubleshooting after creating organization and creating a scan
vi /appdata/deque/mounts/config-server/worldspace-core/production/application.yml
====================================================================================
25. loading a database from backup
- supervisorctl stop all - load the database (mysql import)
26. run db_upgrade.sh (only necessary on first install or reload of database)
27. start registry 28. start ecp-config-server 29. start scan-manager: 30. cat custom-rules.log make sure this starts before you start worldspace comply service 31. start worldspace: 32. on the analysis server: start the services
================================================================================================================= # Some notes from the 6.1.4 upgrade =================================================================================================================
For upgrades only - stop all services supervisorctl stop all - Analysis server: mkdir /etc/nginx/conf.d/ - back up directories Core Server only: /appdata/deque/components/keycloak/standalone/configuration /appdata/deque/mounts/ /appdata/deque/properties/ - uninstall worldspace /appdata/deque/uninstall Remove remaining directories - clean out the application directories - reinstall Enter 21 times Core & Analysis servers - Analysis server does not require database information (insert null data in the prompts) - Analysis server: confirm symlink exists in /etc/supervisor/conf.d -> /appdata/deque/supervisord/comply.conf; supervisorctl reread; supervisorctl update chown worldspace:worldspace /appdata/deque -R - restart nginx after step 3 (post installation steps) - ** do not run first_run ** - Redis/mongo hardening - confirm chrome version is 2.30
======= Production redis password: <<<1 password>>>
Production mongo: mongo admin --port 27018 --eval "db.createUser({ user: 'mongodeque', pwd: '<<<1 password>>>', roles: [ { role: 'dbOwner', db: 'admin' } ] });" mongo deque --port 27018 --eval "db.createUser({ user: 'mongodeque', pwd: '<<<1 password>>>', roles: [ { role: 'dbOwner', db: 'deque' } ] });" mongo deque-custom-rules --port 27018 --eval "db.createUser({ user: 'mongodeque', pwd: 'Q29BgYuExG]jejmZQq', roles: [ { role: 'dbOwner', db:'deque-custom-rules' } ] });"
application.yml: mongodb://mongodeque:<<<1 password>>>@hhs-deque-core-01.prod.hhs.local:27018/deque

Each party agrees that it will not assert, directly or indirectly, any right, title, or interest in, or to, the other party's Marks or register or attempt to register any trademarks, trade names or other proprietary indicia confusingly similar to the Marks of the other party. Neither party grants any rights in the Marks or in any other trademark, trade name, service mark, business name or goodwill of the other except as expressly permitted hereunder or by separate written agreement of the parties. All uses of the other party's Marks shall inure to the benefit of such other party as owner, and the use of either party's Marks in conjunction with the other party's Marks shall not create a unitary or composite mark. Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason, each party shall immediately discontinue any and all use of the other party's Marks, and shall not thereafter use any expression in connection with any business in which such party may thereafter be engaged which, in the reasonable judgment of other party so nearly resembles its Marks as may be likely to lead to confusion or uncertainty on the part of the public. '/appdata/deque/components/auth/standalone/configuration/keycloak-add-user.json', restart server to load user
——————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
Deque 6.0 Notes
The following packages are required for 6.0 (Previously not required): - rabbitmq 3.6.10-1 curl http://www.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq-signing-key-public.asc | sudo apt-key add - apt-get update apt-get install rabbitmq-server rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_management chmod 664 enabled_plugins service rabbitmq-server restart
rabbitmqctl adduser deque deque rabbitmqctl adduser dqadmin admin rabbitmqctl set_permissions -p / dqadmin ".*" ".*" ".*"
- Redis 3.2.9 apt-get install redid-server - Nginx 1.4.6 (already installed)
- supervisor pip install -U pip setuptools easy_install supervisor apt-get install supervisor - xvfb apt-get -y install xvfb - chrome wget -q -O - https://dl-ssl.google.com/linux/linux_signing_key.pub | sudo apt-key add - sudo sh -c 'echo "deb [arch=amd64] http://dl.google.com/linux/chrome/deb/ stable main" >> /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-chrome.list' sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install google-chrome-stable - mongo sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv 0C49F3730359A14518585931BC711F9BA15703C6 echo "deb [ arch=amd64 ] http://repo.mongodb.org/apt/ubuntu trusty/mongodb-org/3.4 multiverse" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-3.4.list apt-get update apt-get install -y mongodb-org - Additional required ports 9100 - Deque support increased logging level (so far no impact to the system) - Be sure to set up cron to clean up /tmp - Install mysql apt-get install mysql-server
- create wsauth and wscomply databases: CREATE DATABASE `wsauth` /*!40100 DEFAULT CHARACTER SET latin1 */ CREATE DATABASE `wscomply` /*!40100 DEFAULT CHARACTER SET latin1 */
create wsdeque user: create user ‘wsdeque’@’10.140.%.%’ identified by ‘password’; grant all privileges on wsauth.* to 'wsdeque'@'10.140.%.%'; grant all privileges on wscomply.* to 'wsdeque'@'10.140.%.%'; flush privileges;
On the analysis server: apt-get install -y supervisor
Create a file called /etc/supervisor/nginx.conf with the following: [program:nginx] command=/usr/sbin/nginx autorestart=false
Starting the Deque services in version 6: - Deque now uses supervisord to start services. To see what’s running, execute the following: supervisorctl status - The running services will be different for each server.
Here’s the core server: ***** Note nginx isn’t currently started by supervisor. this is a known issue. To start nginx, just do a start nginx
root@hhs-deque-core-01:/home/bnguyen# supervisorctl status nginx EXITED Aug 29 01:38 AM scan-manager:ecp-config-server RUNNING pid 39824, uptime 2 days, 0:53:36 scan-manager:ecp-custom-rules RUNNING pid 39930, uptime 2 days, 0:53:35 scan-manager:ecp-gateway RUNNING pid 39893, uptime 2 days, 0:53:35 scan-manager:ecp-manager RUNNING pid 39928, uptime 2 days, 0:53:35 scan-manager:ecp-registry RUNNING pid 39823, uptime 2 days, 0:53:36 scan-worker:ecp-proxy STOPPED Not started scan-worker:ecp-result-processor STOPPED Not started scan-worker:ecp-result-processor2 STOPPED Not started scan-worker:ecp-selenium STOPPED Not started scan-worker:ecp-worker STOPPED Not started scan-worker:ecp-worker2 STOPPED Not started worldspace:comply RUNNING pid 40689, uptime 2 days, 0:51:28 worldspace:keycloak RUNNING pid 40690, uptime 2 days, 0:51:28 root@hhs-deque-core-01:/home/bnguyen#
Here’s the analysis server: root@hhs-deque-analysis-01:~# supervisorctl status scan-manager:ecp-config-server STOPPED Not started scan-manager:ecp-custom-rules STOPPED Not started scan-manager:ecp-gateway STOPPED Not started scan-manager:ecp-manager STOPPED Not started scan-manager:ecp-registry STOPPED Not started scan-worker:ecp-proxy RUNNING pid 69946, uptime 2 days, 0:53:51 scan-worker:ecp-result-processor RUNNING pid 69879, uptime 2 days, 0:53:52 scan-worker:ecp-result-processor2 RUNNING pid 69878, uptime 2 days, 0:53:52 scan-worker:ecp-selenium RUNNING pid 69981, uptime 2 days, 0:53:50 scan-worker:ecp-worker RUNNING pid 70059, uptime 2 days, 0:53:49 scan-worker:ecp-worker2 RUNNING pid 70044, uptime 2 days, 0:53:49 worldspace:comply STOPPED Not started worldspace:keycloak STOPPED Not started root@hhs-deque-analysis-01:~#

item.title: HHS DNS request process
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS: DNS request process

Revision History:
    2020-01-23 09:38:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
- https://tracker.cloud.hhs.gov

- You can find historic DNS requests at: 
  sysadmin_library > Project > HHS > DNS Requests
- Copy an existing file and add the necessary information
- in JIRA, go o the DN-project and attach the file there
- If 2 days pass and you don’t get a response, send an email to Vanessa Williams (Vanessa.Williams@HHS.GOV) and cc Bishal. let her know that you just wanted to follow up with her that you submitted DN-xxx ticket
- if vanessa is on vacation, Alex is her backup: Olexiy.Karakcheyev@hhs.gov
- If alex is out, then Eric is next in line: eric.sun@hhs.gov
- If Eric is out then your options may be limited.
- If you are scheduling a DNS request for a specific window please indicate that and make sure you coordinate well ahead of time with either Vanessa or Alex.

Or if you a) want to skip all of that or b) do not have access to JIRA c) do not have access to DN, feel free to send Bao a message with the information who will always be happy to help. If you'd like to address your access, someone from the SA team can[should be able to] help you....hopefully.

item.title: hhs immutable infra knowledge dump
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Immutable infra knowledge dump (incomplete)

Revision History:
    2019-11-14 10:30:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Notes from the catchup on 9-Nov 2019:

D8 profiles
- is nothing more than a drupal8 implementation with predefined workflow/charateristics/modules etc
- makes it easier to stand up a site
- this was built in salt and jenkins hybrid jobs(freestyle pipelines)
- was done on ubuntu14
- components are in the salt pillar and salt base
- and ctac-jenkins scripts/pipelines
- to put up a d8 site today, you'd find an example of salt pillars & base profile & duplicate that information (use foodsafety or careers and make sure everything is duplicated)
- set up a new tab for that projectid in jenkins, and clone something like careers/foodsafety and set that up to build/deploy the utility jobs
- we are currently in process of converting salt base to 16.04 puppet base (step 1 in conversion process). foodsafety-dev is currently 16.04 and working on rollout plan
- make sure any new projects are using 16.04 as their base. (use foodsafety-dev as example)
- the legacy builds & deploy use 1 build per environment (separate builds for dev/stage/qa/prod).  the future is a full deploy of pipeline jobs. we have recreated all of the utility jobs and converted to the new pipeline using new ctac jenkins shared libraries repo(100% pipeline code). the d8profile builds & deployments will also be in that pipeline, so setting that up will be a matter of changing parameters and some libraries
- there is no varnish. the only use case is if they are not using akamai
- there is no multi-site
- every projectID gets its own set of hardware
- the akamai origin can be on an existing ALB (eg: careers), and you can set up target groups to to point to the backend servers for that project. and target groups would need to be associated with the cloudformation script
- these systems are locked down with security group references. if you add an ALB to the front, make sure that one of its security groups is authorized to access the instance
- bloodcell is a one-off. it's a static instance so don't use bloodcell
- each instance has EFS associated. They are backed up by AWS backup. To restore you have the option to restore to a disk, and then restore the file(s) as needed
- Databases are all snapshotted. to restore: create a snapshot and reimport that database into the original RDS
- for the d8 stuff, with the exception of bloodcell, nobody should have ssh access. There are run command jobs within jenkins that allow release managers to do what they need to do on their system. Once this is fully implemented there should be little support from the SA team.
- SA's own production(database restore, filesystem restore)
- URLs - internal URLs will need DNS entries & overrides(Route 53, HHS, servername, nginx config, salt config-or eventually parameter store, ALB listener rules). environment-projectID.cloud.hhs.gov (eg stage-foodsafety.cloud.hhs.gov)
- for d8 profile sites, we are not technically doing builds. ie we're not building the drupal stuff. webfirst has it set up so that the repo has a prebuilt drupal.
- LDAP groups (remember to update the project billing spreadsheet)
- 


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: hhs jenkins upgrade
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Jenkins upgrade process

Revision History:
    2019-03-11 23:25:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

jenkins upgrade

- determine jenkins version you want to upgrade. Ideally this would be the latest LTS version.
- download that version
- stop jenkins
/etc/init.d/jenkins stop
- cd /usr/share/jenkins
- backup the existing jenkins war file: /usr/share/jenkins/jenkins.war
eg: cp /usr/share/jenkins.war /usr/share/jenkins/jenkins.war.orig
- download the new version to /usr/share/jenkins/jenkins.war
- change permissions:
chmod 755 /usr/share/jenkins/jenkins.war
- restart jenkins
 /etc/init.d/jenkins restart
 - watch the log file for errors
 tail -f /var/log/jenkins/jenkins.log
 - test UI login
 - test jobs


=================================================

item.title: HHS LDAP group naming convention
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS: LDAP group naming convention (general guidance)

Revision History:
    2020-04-16 10:20:00 - Version 1 created by Bao, but almost entirely from Paul's notes

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

CI:
- ldap-01.svcs.hhs.local


The general guidance for naming of LDAP groups is as follows: {projectid}-{technology}-{role}

For example, if your....
projectid is docrep
technology is drupal
role is users....

then your LDAP group name would be docrep-drupal-users.


Let's say we now add an opdiv/staffdiv to the LDAP group name, then the general guidance for the LDAP group name would be: {projectid}-{technology}-{opdiv}-{role}

For example, if your....
projectid is docrep
technology is drupal
opdiv is os
role is users...

...then your LDAP group name would be: docrep-drupal-os-users


The idea is to better group LDAP groups hierarchical and segment by project id. The only reserved names are {project id}-developers, {project id}-release-managers and {project id}-admins. admins is used for SSH auth, release managers and developers is used for ci/cd and services. Everything else for a project is used within  the application.



=================================================

disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of

item.title: HHS maintenance window notification process
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS maintenance window notification process

Revision History:
    2017-03-08 09:57:52 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Applies to:
- sending notifications for HHS functions that Booz is also involved

Recipients

HHS Employees
- Anthony.Hamilton@hhs.gov
- Darryl.Cunningham@hhs.gov
- Eric.Sun@hhs.gov
- Olexiy.Karakcheyev@hhs.gov
- Shantoyia.Adewunmi@hhs.gov

Aquilent (Retired - please use the booz list)
- Robert.Calabro@aquilent.com
- arash.farazdaghi@aquilent.com
- ryan.cawley@aquilent.com
- ryan.shapiro@aquilent.com
- Kelley.Mesa@aquilent.com
- alexander.wendler@aquilent.com

Booz (Distribution lists)
LRL-ASPADevelopers@bah.com
LRL-aspapmo@bah.com

(optional)
- Calabro_Robert@bah.com
- Farazdaghi_Arash@bah.com
- Cawley_Ryan@bah.com
- Shapiro_Ryan@bah.com
- Mesa_Kelley@bah.com
- Wendler_Alexander@bah.com

CC
- cdoyle@ctacorp.com
- techsupport@ctacorp.com

Notification requirements:
1) Project Manager: provides verbal notification in the cloud infrastructure meeting (occurs Wednesdays).
2) Project Manager: send email notification the day of the maintenance window.
3) SA: send email notification upon beginning the maintenance window.
4) SA: send email notification upon completion of the maintenance window. Include details of any issues.

item.title: HHS OpenAM
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS OpenAM

Revision History:
    2019-07-30 15:20:00 - Version 1 created by bao


Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Notes: If after reading this document you are still confused, then you are not alone. Reread and ask questions.

CI:
- evd.hhs.gov (not managed by WCMS AWS VPC)
- AMS
- ldap-01.svcs.hhs.local
- ldap-02.svcs.hhs.local
- hhs-openam-01.prod.hhs.local
- hhs-wcdams-01.prod.hhs.local
- hhs-web-01.prod.hhs.local
- hhs-web-02.prod.hhs.local
- proxy-01.prod.hhs.local

Prerequisites:
- Should read this: https://docs.google.com/document/d/10Env80cCeDEfJGF2ixNmHwi04xSTgUVKSBjZMZJ38Fo/edit. If you don't have access, request it from SA


Applications that comprise SSO:
- LDAP (obviously)
- AMS (ams.hhs.gov)
- OpenAM (wcdsso.cloud.hhs.gov)
- wcdams (wcdams.hhs.gov)
- Apache webservers for proxying


What is AMS?
- Stands for Access Management System
- is not managed by CTAC

What is OpenAM?
- tomcat application
- nhttps://backstage.forgerock.com/docs/openam/13.5/getting-started/
- OpenAM is an access management tool
- is one of the moving parts in how our applications authenticate with HHS using SSO
- is managed by CTAC

What is WCDAMS?
- Rails application
- is another moving part in how our applications authenticate with HHS using SSO
- is managed by CTAC

Why do we use Apache web servers?
- Short answer: just because. It was this way in the beginning and thus remains.
- We could investigate removing web servers, but up to this point it has not been a priority

Where do user accounts come from?
1) AMS
- LDAP sync on ldap-01.svcs.hhs.local
2) created in LDAP
- cmdshelf
******* For any account created in LDAP, ensure that the HHS ID exists (employeeNumber). **********

At this point hopefully the diagram makes sense. in https://docs.google.com/document/d/10Env80cCeDEfJGF2ixNmHwi04xSTgUVKSBjZMZJ38Fo/edit.

Flow of authentication:
1) User attempts to log into an application that is protected by AMS
2) If cookie is not set, user is presented the login page at ams.hhs.gov
3) If successful authentication at ams.hhs.gov, then OpenAM/WCDAMS will grant access, and user is redirected back to the application.
4) if failed authentication, user will remain at ams.hhs.gov


Common errors & troubleshooting AMS access issues:
- AMS is having their own issues (AMS error 1101 or similar)
- browser Cache (almost always the problem)
- 404 error (accounts with duplicate HHS ID)
- page refresh loop (user is not in the correct group)
- For Ruby on Rails: 'We're sorry, something went wrong' (user is not in the correct group)


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

s3://ctac-migrate/jre-8u231-linux-x64.tar.gz

item.title: HHS override dns entries
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysic Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: How to override DNS entries in HHS via puppet

Revision History:
    2017-7-30 08:24:06 - Version 1 created by Bao

Description:
Not all URLs are available over Sophos VPN (i.e. some URLs are only available to HHS network. While this is fine for CTAC employees with VPN into CTAC HQ, this leaves a gap for non-CTAC employees. The first suggestion is to spoof the local machine, but unfortunately not all[most???] non-CTACemployees possess the knowledge and skill to edit /etc/hosts files. The discussed solution was to override the DNS lookup via the puppet manifest.

Overview:
- add the DNS entries in the  arecords.pp file in the module
- edit the DNS entries in the init.pp file in the module

Details:

Quick and dirty method:
- cd to the profile_hhs_dns/manifest directory
cd /etc/puppetlabs/puppet/hhs_puppet_rp/environments/production/modules/profile_hhs_dns/manifests
- grep for an entry that exists
grep webstandards *
- modify the files that are returned in the output, using what you grepped as an example.









Method 2: the step by step kb version:
- vi the arecords file:
vi /etc/puppetlabs/puppet/hhs_puppet_rp/environments/production/modules/profile_hhs_dns/manifests/arecords.pp

- scroll to the bottom of the file and before the closing brace add the following. Remember to substitute your values accordingly:

  'override-<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>’:
    host => 'xx',
    zone => '<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>',
    data => [‘<<<<<THE-IP-ADDRESS-TO-SPOOF>>>>>>>>’],

- save and quit the file

- vi the init.pp file
vi /etc/puppetlabs/puppet/hhs_puppet_rp/environments/production/modules/profile_hhs_dns/manifests/arecords/init.pp

- look for a section titled ‘Forward Zone’.
- Scroll through the existing entries until you reach the end of the ‘Forward Zone’ section
- Add the following to the file:
    dns::zone { '<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>':
        soa            => 'dns-01',
        soa_email      => 'techsupport@ctacorp.com',
        nameservers    => ['dns-01','dns-02'],
        zone_type      => $type,
        zone_notify    => $zone_notify,
        allow_transfer => $allow_transfer,
        slave_masters  => $slave_masters,
    }
- Scroll to the ‘a-records’ section
- go to the end of this section and add the following:
    dns::record::a {
        'override-<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>':
            host => ' ',
            zone => '<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>',
            data => ['<<<<<THE-IP-ADDRESS-TO-SPOOF>>>>>>>>'],
    }
- save and quit
- run puppet on dns-01 and dns-02


Troubleshooting and misc
- if you require 2 IP addresses to spoof, edit the files accordingly:
arecords.pp:
  'override-<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>':
    host => 'xx',
    zone => '<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>',
    data => ['<<<<<THE-FIRST-IP-ADDRESS-TO-SPOOF>>>>>>>>', '<<<<<THE-SECOND-IP-ADDRESS-TO-SPOOF>>>>>>>>''],


init.pp:
    dns::record::a {
        'override-<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>':
            host => ' ',
            zone => '<<<<<THE-URL-TO-OVERRIDE>>>>>>>',
            data => ['<<<<<THE-FIRST-IP-ADDRESS-TO-SPOOF>>>>>>>>', '<<<<<THE-SECOND-IP-ADDRESS-TO-SPOOF>>>>>>>>'],
    }


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: HHS Puppet Error Could not retrieve catalog from remote server Error 400 on SERVER Duplicate declaration Dns Record Ptr
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Puppet Error: Error: Could not retrieve catalog from remote server: Error 400 on SERVER: Duplicate declaration: Dns::Record::Ptr

Revision History:
    2017-10-21 01:52:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

CI:
- puppetmaster.svcs.hhs.local


Full error:

Error: Could not retrieve catalog from remote server: Error 400 on SERVER: Duplicate declaration: Dns::Record::Ptr[11.120.140.10.IN-ADDR.ARPA] is already declared in file /etc/puppetlabs/puppet/hhs_puppet_rp/environments/production/modules/dns/manifests/record/a.pp:31; cannot redeclare at /etc/puppetlabs/puppet/hhs_puppet_rp/environments/production/modules/dns/manifests/record/a.pp:31 on node dns-01.svcs.hhs.local
Warning: Not using cache on failed catalog
Error: Could not retrieve catalog; skipping run


Steps:
- on dns-01.svcs.hhs.local, do an nslookup on the IP address. Hint: The error should mention it(11.120.140.10). So…..

nslookup 10.140.120.11

- The FQDN should be returned
- Log into puppet and deactivate the node:
puppet node deactivate <the FQDN from the previous command>
- Voila.



And yes, this was written at 2am



=================================================

disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: hhs rails appication deployment general
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Rails Application Deployment (General Application)

Revision History:
    2015-04-14 10:03:00 - Version 1.a Typos and a few misc notes added by Bao
    2015-04-14 9:03:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
    http://deploy.cloud.hhs.gov
    http://deploy-aws.cloud.hhs.gov
    http://bitbucket.org


Prerequisites
You have an LDAP account in HHS.
You are on HHS VPN.
You can connect to the CTAC VPN.
A ticket in HHS Jira exists for this deployment; deployment instructions are included in this ticket.
A notification email has been sent to the pertinent parties (Tony, Craig, tech support, PM, and the developer assigned to the application).

Logging Into Deploy Tool / Webistrano / Capistrano
1) Go to http://deploy.cloud.hhs.gov (or deploy-aws.cloud.hhs.gov)
2) Log in with your LDAP credentials.

Deploying the update
1) Expand the desired application from the list on the left. Stage applications will be labeled stage. Dev applications will be labeled dev. Production will not be labeled.
2) Click the environment type (prod, stage, dev) under the expanded application link.
3) Edit the branch line and change the value to what is specified in the deployment instructions.
4) Save.
5) In the “All tasks” dropdown, select ‘deploy:update code’.
6) Select Execute.
7) Return to the “All Tasks” dropdown and select “Webistrano:Unicorn:Restart”.
8) Select Execute.

Validation
Once your work of the deployment is complete notify the  PM and/or dev, who will validate the application is good.

Miscellaneous
- If the application has separate Admin and Public portions, deploy the admin portion first. This will be the case if, in Deploy Tool, you see separate applications of the same name with Admin, API, or Public appended to it.
- You can also access deploy tool by going to http://deploy-as-01:3000. This is useful when you’re not in the office.
- Sometimes you will need to run rake tasks. These can be found in the ‘All tasks’ dropdown in the Deploy Tool. Make note of the following:
1) When possible, db:migrate tasks should be run from the Deploy Tool. The only exception is when the application is load-balanced on more than 1 application server.
2) db rake tasks should be run before you restart the application.
- If you start the application from the command line BE SURE THAT YOU ARE THE RUBY-APP USER.
- If you run rake tasks from the command line BE SURE THAT YOU ARE THE RUBY-APP USER.
- If you run rake tasks from the command line, make sure you’re in the /appdata/<name of application>/current directory.


Troubleshooting
- If you get an error, the log is printed in the browser. 
- You can also ssh into the application server and review the same logs. The application server(s) will be listed in the Deploy Tool, under the respective application. The logs are in:
/appdata/<name of app>/current/log




=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: hhs resetting user ldap passwords
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Reseetting User LDAP Passwords

Revision History:
    2019-07-03 10:12:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Prerequisites:
- None


Misc:
- If an email was sent you have 2 options:
1) create a ticket in JIRA on their behalf
2) ask the requester to create a ticket in JIRA


Resetting passwords:
You currently have a few options for this, but do note that these options may change without notice:
1) Apache Studio on your local machine. Connection string/admin password/etc are in 1Password
2) using the passwd command on a server
3) cmdshelf


Now the important part:
Once you have reset the user's password, send a onetime link:
fugacio.us
onetimesecret
...or use your preferred delivery method.

And the most important part of the task send 1) an email using the below sample:

Hello <name of recipient>
Your new password can be retrieved at https://onetimesecret.com/secret/og12nj8o27l1i9wwpgx2aeeap5ltef9

Note: this link will expire after 7 days or 1 view.

thank you,



2) add a note in the ticket using the below sample:
Hello <name of recipient>
Your new password can be retrieved at ***REDACTED***

Note: this link will expire after 7 days or 1 view.

thank you,


If the user is still having issues, or complains about being unable to retrieve the password. Ask them for a number & time to talk. Call them and read the password over the phone.

Finally: close the ticket.

item.title: hhs restarting searchblox
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: How to restart searchblox application

Revision History:
    2019-02-03 15:50:14 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


- If you get an error that searchblox index isn't accessible
- If you get an 503 when going to the searchblox admin console for the index server


CI: 
https://stage-searchblox-index.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/admin/main.jsp



1) On each server run the following command to stop the service:
service searchblox stop

1b) Run a ps -ef | grep searchblox to ensure that the application has stopped
2) Start searchblox first on the index server:
service searchblox start

2b) After you start service on the index server, tail /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/logs/status.log and check for the following:
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:49:36,604> <status> <SearchBlox Version 8.6.9>
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:49:36,604> <status> <JVM Vendor: Oracle Corporation>
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:49:36,604> <status> <JVM Version: 1.8.0_172>
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:49:36,604> <status> <Server Information : jetty/9.3.6.v20151106 Version 3.1>
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:49:36,604> <status> <OS Information : amd64|Linux|4.4.0-1074-aws>
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:49:36,604> <status> <Host IP Address : 54.89.91.54>
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:49:36,611> <status> <Memory: 19 GB | 18 GB>


NOTE: If you get to this point in the logs then you are in luck and can continue to the new step. If you don't then this KB isn't going to be of much help.

2c) Watch for the following log message in the status.log (should be another minute or 2). Once you see this message proceed to step 3:
INFO  <03 Feb 2019 20:50:17,891> <status> <2019/02/03 20:50:17 Scheduler started>

3) start searchblox on the remaining search servers:
service searchblox start

4) Check for errors in status.log on any of the servers. If no errors then the application should be back up and you can confirm by logging into the URL of any of the servers.


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: hhs saltmaster does not pull latest code
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================


Subject: HHS Saltmaster does not pull latest code from repository (lock file exists)

Revision History:
    2017-08-15 16:18:00 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen
    

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


Note: 

Behavior:
Running the below command to pull the code repo onto the salt master:
salt-call event.fire_master update salt/fileserver/gitfs/update

Results in:
Local: 
  True


But you still don’t see the code updated. Or…you have updated a file on a minion and added new variables but on a salt.apply, the variables get overwritten. 


==========
Solution
==========

First, ensure that the code from bitbucket is either being updated or not being updated. I found the code by doing an `updatedb` and a `locate pillar`, which produced some results in /var/cache/salt/master/git_pillar/<a hash of the code>/

cd into that directory and compare whether the code has been updated or not. If not updated, check /var/log/salt/master for any suggestions. The first time weviewed the log file, nothing was being written. So I restarted the salt master, and other salt services (using init script).

Upon restarting, I noticed some output in the logs as follows:
[salt.utils.gitfs ][WARNING ][29581] Update lock file is present for git_pillar remote 'master git@bitbucket.org:CTACSYSADMIN/ctac-saltstack-pillar-hhs.git', skipping. If this warning persists, it is possible that the update process was interrupted, but the lock could also have been manually set. Removing /var/cache/salt/master/git_pillar/5474f0dda9ee2ebd0b29448872ee4b8232de05f090256bd087cd640113d63ade/.git/update.lk or running 'salt-run cache.clear_git_lock git_pillar type=update' will allow updates to continue for this remote.


So, run that command:
salt-run cache.clear_git_lock git_pillar type=update

Then check for the existence of the lock file:
ls -la /var/cache/salt/master/git_pillar/5474f0dda9ee2ebd0b29448872ee4b8232de05f090256bd087cd640113d63ade/.git/update.lk


If all is well, try another run of the fire_master and you should get better results.



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: hhs searchblox ami setup configuration
item.description:
wKnowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Searchblox AMI (General)

Revision History:
    2018-12-11 08:55:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
- search urls for now:
https://alb-hhs-searchblox-stg-1752384076.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com/searchblox/ocr/index.html
https://alb-hhs-searchblox-stg-1752384076.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com/searchblox/hhs/index.html
index-01: http://54.89.91.54/searchblox/admin/main.jsp
search-01: http://18.204.171.245/searchblox/admin/main.jsp
search-02: http://34.197.28.78/searchblox/admin/main.jsp
https://alb-hhs-searchblox-stg-1752384076.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com/searchblox/hhs/index.html

DNS:
stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov
stage-searchblox-idex.cloud.hhs.gov
stage-searchblox-search-01.cloud.hhs.gov
stage-searchblox-search-02.cloud.hhs.gov

Background info
A company called Strategic Communications was contracted to create an AMI to be used in the HHS AWS environment. It was not communicated the security posture of the servers, and therefore this server is currently treated as an appliance. 

Prerequisites:
- You have the SSH Keypair available
- The AMI is available for use
- Three servers have been created: 1 index & 2 search. Each server is in a separate subnet.
- The 3 servers are created in a public subnet with an Elastic IP assigned
- The license is has been supplied by Searchblox (or vendor)
- Servers are created with 1TB available for /opt

Server configuration (Post EC2 creation)
- After creating the servers from the supplied AMI, follow these steps for starting searchblox application:
1) /etc/hosts file
2) /etc/hostname file
3) the hostname itself
4) Apply the changes
5) Enable https
6) Start the searchblox service
7) Apply the license
8) Update elasticsearch.yml file
9) Configure Cluster
10) Optional: create a test collection

Step 1:
- modify /etc/hosts file
add the following lines:
127.0.0.1 <Elastic IP Address>
127.0.1.1 <Elastic IP Address>

Step 2:
- modify /etc/hostname file:
replace the contents with <Elastic IP Address>

Step 3:
- run the following command:
hostname <Elastic IP Address>

Step 4:
- Type:
exit
- Type:
'sudo su' to return to the root user


Step 5:
- to enable https, run this command:
cd /opt/searchblox/
java -server -jar start.jar --add-to-startd=https


Step 6:
- To start the searchblox service, run the following command. First run this on the index server, and tail -f /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/logs/status.log. Once the service has started, run the same commands on both of the search servers
service searchblox start

Step 7:
- To get the Searchblox application to run using it's Elastic IP, Elasticsearch needs to communicate via the Private IP, need to modify /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/WEB-INF/elasticsearch.yml file and update the following:
*** Note: the below scrape is just an example. You will want to modify the Elastic IP and public IPs accordingly.
Essentially:
*** network.host should be the local(private) ip adddress ***
*** add network.publish_host should be the public IP address ***


root@54:/opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/WEB-INF# cat elasticsearch.yml
cluster.name: searchblox
node.name: sb_node_54_89_91_54
indices.fielddata.cache.size: 40%
http.enabled: true
elasticfence.disabled: false
elasticfence.root.password: searchblox
index.refresh_interval: 4s
searchblox.shards: 1
searchblox.replica: 0
searchblox.master: 54.89.91.54
network.host: 10.140.102.120
network.publish_host: 54.89.91.54
discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts: [54.89.91.54,18.204.171.245,34.197.28.78]




For search-01:
cluster.name: searchblox
node.name: sb_node_18_204_171_245
indices.fielddata.cache.size: 40%
http.enabled: true
elasticfence.disabled: false
elasticfence.root.password: searchblox
index.refresh_interval: 4s
searchblox.shards: 1
searchblox.replica: 0
searchblox.master: 54.89.91.54
discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts: [54.89.91.54,18.204.171.245,34.197.28.78]
network.host: 10.140.100.242
network.publish_host: 18.204.171.245



For search-02:
cluster.name: searchblox
node.name: sb_node_34_197_28_78
indices.fielddata.cache.size: 40%
http.enabled: true
elasticfence.disabled: false
elasticfence.root.password: searchblox
index.refresh_interval: 4s
searchblox.shards: 1
searchblox.replica: 0
searchblox.master: 54.89.91.54
discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts: [54.89.91.54,18.204.171.245,34.197.28.78]
network.host: 10.140.100.242
network.publish_host: 34.197.28.78




Step 7b: restart searchblox application from the command line:
service searchblox restart



Step 8:
To Apply the license
- log into http://<Elastic IP>/searchblox/admin/main.jsp?
- go to Admin > New License > Browse > Apply new license (One license per server)



Step 9: 
Configure cluster
In the UI > login > Admin > Cluster
Add the servers of index & search (specify public IPs)
The IP address for the cluster should match discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts in elasticsearch.yml


Step 10:
Hopefully all goes well up to this point. If that is the case, you can either a) start indexing and/or b) create a test collection. For a, make sure that the Collection is replicated to the other servers. For both, follow the steps in the Searchblox guide.



====== Troubleshooting ========
- Clean indexed documents. Do this only when creating a cluster after one has been removed: 
1) stop searchblox service (all servers)
2) rm -rf /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/index/* (All servers)
3) start searchblox service (index first)

- Start searchblox in the foreground
cd /opt/searchblox
./startSearchblox

== Stop/Reboot servers ===
1) on index server stop all collections
- stop indexing of Collections within the dasbhoard (In the UI, click Index on a Collection and then click Stop)
- stop searchblox service from command line
- then stop/reboot
2) stop/reboot search-01
3) stop/reboot search-02

== Check red/green ===
For anything that is red, it means that Elasticsearch is behind. But not to worry; the count of Red should decrease and catchup.
curl -u root:searchblox 10.140.102.120:9200/_cat/indices


=== Misc Notes ===
Splunk setup
- obtain splunkforwarder-6.4.0-f2c836328108-linux-2.6-amd64.deb from puppet
dpkg -i splunkforwarder-6.4.0-f2c836328108-linux-2.6-amd64.deb
- accept any EULA
- Add splunk-02: 
/opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk add forward-server 10.140.228.155:9997
- add splunk-03: 
/opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk add forward-server 10.140.229.155:9997
- Configure indexes/logs
/opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk add monitor /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/logs/ -index searchblox_stg -sourcetype %app%
/opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk add monitor /var/log/ -index os
- enable boot-start
/opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk enable boot-start


To view facet.js information go to /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/<name of plugin>/facet.js 
or
go to the URL of the plugin: https://stage-search.cloud.hhs.gov/searchblox/hhs/facet.js

- When creating the server in TF, be sure to tfplan 3 resources as follows:
tfapplyhhs --target aws_instance.hhs-searchblox-index-01-stg --target aws_ebs_volume.hhs-searchblox-index-01-stg_dev_sdf --target aws_volume_attachment.hhs-searchblox-index-01-stg_dev_sdf

== Clearing query log == 
If load  persists after restarting the application it's possible that the querylog index has grown to a size that is too large for searchblox to handle.

First query the indices to find the size of the query log:
Stage:
curl -u root:searchblox 10.140.102.80:9200/_cat/indices

Prod:
curl -u root:searchblox 10.140.10.111:9200/_cat/indices

Then if the query log looks large, then clear out the log:
Stage:
curl -u root:searchblox -X DELETE "10.140.102.80:9200/querylogs?pretty"
curl -u root:searchblox 10.140.102.80:9200/_cat/indices

production:
curl -u root:searchblox -X DELETE "10.140.10.111:9200/querylogs?pretty"
curl -u root:searchblox 10.140.10.111:9200/_cat/indices

then restart searchblox on all 3 servers




=================
Change the number of read replicas:
curl -u root:searchblox -XPUT '10.140.10.111:9200/_settings' -d '
{
"index" : {
"number_of_replicas" : 1
}
}'

curl -k -u root:searchblox -XGET 'http://10.140.10.111:9200/*/_settings/index.number_of_replicas'

item.title: hhs sophos vpn user creation
item.description:
IKnowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Sophos VPN User creation

Revision History:
    2015-09-16 11:26:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Prerequisites:
  You have Apache Studio installed
  You have access to HHS VPN
  Apache studio is configured to log into dns-02.svcs.hhs.local

Links:
  https://52.2.163.127 (That’s port 443)


Overview:
  Add the user to the LDAP group
  Send the user instructions for logging into the Sophos via UI.

Detailed steps:
Step 1 add user to LDAP
  Log into dns-02.svcs.hhs.local via Apache Studio
- expand ou=groups
- select cn=hhs_vpn_user
- add a new member ex:
uid=bnguyen,ou=people,dc=hhs,dc=local


Step 2 Send user instructions for logging into Sophos via UI. Email this and they should be good to go:

HHS Sophos VPN Creation & Connection

- go to https://52.2.163.127/ and log in with your LDAP credentials
- Once you have successfully logged in you will be presented with a QR code. Use your favorite OTP tool (e.g. Google Authenticator, 1Password, Authy..etc) to obtain your OTP token.
- Click the ‘Proceed with login’ button
- Select ‘Log out’ from the menu.
- Log back in using your username and password + OTP token value. (e.g. if your password is xyz!1234!abc and your token is 012987 your full password would be xyz! 1234!abc012987)
- After a successful login: select Remote Access from menu.
- Download & install the option most appropriate for your situation. Viscosity users will use the third button.
- Test your VPN connection. When connecting you will be prompted for user name and password. The password for VPN is the same as above. Your password + OTP Token Value (e.g. if your password is xyz!1234!abc and your token is 012987 your full password would be xyz!1234!abc012987).


=================== Spiel ===================

Hello,
Your Sophos VPN account has been created. Instructions to obtain your VPN certs are attached. Details as follows:
Username is: 
password can be retrieved at:

Please note the following: 
- Sophos VPN password can be reset at https://passwordreset.cloud.hhs.gov. 
- The above link will expire after 7 days or 1 view.
- Sophos VPN uses LDAP authentication, which is a separate, unrelated account to JIRA, which uses AMS authentication.

if you run into any issues, please open a ticket in HHS JIRA at https://tracker.cloud.hhs.gov or send an email to techsupport@ctacorp.com

Thank you,



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: AMS Support

    2020-07-15 22:04:38 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Step 1:
if [ "$(grep -Ei 'ID=ubuntu|VERSION_ID="18.04"' /etc/os-release)" ]; then sed -i "s/trusty/xenial/g" /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades; elif [ "$(grep -Ei 'ID=ubuntu|VERSION_ID="16.04"' /etc/os-release)" ]; then sed -i "s/xenial/trusty/g" /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades; else echo "Neither 16.04 or 18.04"; fi

Step 2:
sudo sed -i '/^Unattended-Upgrade\:\:Package-Blacklist/,+3 s/^/\/\//' /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades && sudo apt-get update && DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get upgrade --with-new-pkgs -y  -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" && sudo unattended-upgrade -d  && apt-get autoremove -y

Step 3:
sudo dpkg -l linux-{image,headers}-* | awk '/^ii/{print $2}' | egrep '[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+' | awk 'BEGIN{FS="-"}; {if ($3 ~ /[0-9]+/) print $3"-"$4,$0; else if ($4 ~ /[0-9]+/) print $4"-"$5,$0}' | sort -k1,1 --version-sort -r | sed -e "1,/$(uname -r | cut -f1,2 -d"-")/d" | grep -v -e `uname -r | cut -f1,2 -d"-"` | awk '{print $2}' | xargs sudo DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" purge

do-release-upgrade

Step 5:
No candidate ver:  systemd-services

re-enable them after the upgrade with the 'software-properties' tool
or your package manager.
To continue please press [ENTER]

Do you want to start the upgrade?
2 installed packages are no longer supported by Canonical. You can
still get support from the community.
15 packages are going to be removed. 157 new packages are going to be
installed. 739 packages are going to be upgraded.
You have to download a total of 508 M. This download will take about
1 hour 4 minutes with a 1Mbit DSL connection and about 19 hours with
a 56k modem.
Fetching and installing the upgrade can take several hours. Once the
download has finished, the process cannot be canceled.
 Continue [yN]  Details [d]

 Step 7:
 Kerberos: leave blank

 Steps 8 & 9:
