item.title: HHS_Ubuntu_18
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================


Subject: HHS Ubuntu 18.04 Base AMI Build

Revision History:
    2020-08-05 11:00:00 - Version 1 created by Ali Muhammad


Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


==============================
Introduction
==============================

The purpose of this KB is to provide information regarding the HHS Ubuntu 18.04 AMI Build.



==============================
Quick Links
==============================

HHS AWS Code Build: https://console.aws.amazon.com/codesuite/codebuild/249709554004/projects/HHS-Ubuntu-1804-base-ami/history?region=us-east-1

Source Repository: https://bitbucket.org/CTACSYSADMIN/sysadmin_packer/src/master/


==============================
Core Build Flow
==============================

- HHS Ubuntu 18.04 Base AMI is built using Code Build in HHS AWS Account.

- Build Project Name in CodeBuild is "HHS-Ubuntu-1804-base-ami".

- "HHS-Ubuntu-1804-base-ami" CodeBuild runs the Buildspec file "hhs-buildspec-base-1804.yml" that is located in https://bitbucket.org/CTACSYSADMIN/sysadmin_packer/src/master/hhs-buildspec-base-1804.yml

- hhs-buildspec-base-1804.yml does the following operations:

  * Runs on container image: aws/codebuild/standard:4.0
  * Downloads and sets up packer binary. The version of packer to download is passed as an environment variable "PACKER_VERSION" in the code build.
  * Downloads and sets up jq binary.
  * Configures the AWS Region
  * Downloads HHS CA certificate contents from SSM Paramstore path: /service-core/cert/ca
  * Calls https://bitbucket.org/CTACSYSADMIN/sysadmin_packer/src/master/hhs/base-1804/files.sh (The actions performed by this shell script will be explained further down).
  * Runs `packer validate <packer-json-build-filename-here>` to validate the build json file.
  * Runs `packer build <packer-json-build-filename-here>` to launch a packer build for `amazon-ebs` type i.e. the type of Packer Builder used is amazon-ebs (information here: https://www.packer.io/docs/builders/amazon/ebs )
  * Echo's out a build completed statement once the build has run.


==============================
Core Build Components
==============================

- sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/files.sh loads variables stored in sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/vars.sh. This consist of the 2nd and 3rd volume names to attach, Source AMI to utilize, AWS Account number and many others.

- sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/files.sh loads our custom libraries stored in sysadmin_packer/_common/incl-common-libs.sh

- sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/files.sh creates a HEREDOC for CloudConfig which is utilized in the packer build.

- sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/files.sh templates out a packer.json file containing all Packer related actions to build out an AWS AMI using amazon-ebs packer builder.

- Newly introduced portion to support 3 Volumes in packer.json build file configuration "launch_block_device_mappings":

  * Root block device (sda1) of 15GBs containing a single partition that stores Operating system.
  * Secondary block device (sdf) containing six partitions to support CIS requirements. One each for /tmp, /var, /var/tmp, /var/log, /var/log/audit and /home
  * Secondary block device (sdg) containing a single partition dedicated to /appdata

- Provisioners in packer.json:

  * File type provisioner to SCP sysadmin_packer/_common/installers/install-ubuntu18-update-1.sh to the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * File type provisioner to SCP sysadmin_packer/_common/installers/install-ubuntu18-update-2.sh to the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * File type provisioner to SCP sysadmin_packer/_common/installers/install-prometheus-node-exporter.sh to the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * File type provisioner to SCP the certificate file std'd out to a hhs_ca.crt file from /service-core/cert/ca SSM paramstore to the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * Shell type provisioner to execute sysadmin_packer/_common/installers/install-ubuntu18-update-1.sh shell script on the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * Shell type provisioner to execute sysadmin_packer/_common/installers/install-ubuntu18-update-2.sh shell script on the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * Shell type provisioner to execute commands for moving hhs_ca.crt to /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/ and running update-ca-certificates on the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * File type provisioner to SCP sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/scripts folder to the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * Shell type provisioner to execute command for running  prelim_00_partitioning.sh (this script does partitioning, creates filesystems, injects mountpoint entries - it expects that you have two disks of type XVD attached named as sdf and sdg) on the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder. It removes the scripts folder mentioned in the previous step after completion.
  * File type provisioner to SCP sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/scripts folder to the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder. (AFTER PARTITIONING)
  * Shell type provisioner to execute command which runs sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/scripts/install_ubuntu-bionic-base.sh  on the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder. install_ubuntu-bionic-base.sh calls all the other shell scripts that are present in the sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/scripts folder. It first runs all the pre*.sh scripts in a chronological order. pre*.sh scripts contain custom HHS changes. After running pre*.sh scripts, the CIS scripts are called which are named like section_*.sh and are run in a chronological order. Followed by the CIS section scripts, the SSM paramstore script sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/scripts/install_ssm_paramstore.sh is executed which configures the configuration for HHS LDAP.
  * Shell type provisioner to execute commands for running the SSM paramstore script sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/scripts/install_ssm_paramstore.sh, which configures the configuration for HHS LDAP on the EC2 for amazon-ebs AMI builder.
  * Shell type provisioner to execute commands for running the SSM paramstore script sysadmin_packer/hhs/base-1804/scripts/cleanup.sh, which removes SSM paramstore components (i.e. template, ssm-paramstore python file, ssm paramstore template and config.py file).  It also performs a removal of everything under /home/ubuntu as well as running an APT CLEAN to remove all archived debian files.




=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.description:

Subject: Creating new LDAP user in HHS

Revision History:
    2015-08-11 14:21:00 - Version 1 created by bao-bao
    2017-01-19 11:34:00 - edited by Andrew: completed/added steps for jira-users

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Applies to
- HHS environment

Prerequisites
— Ticket exists in Jira for this request
- At a minimum, the following information is available for this user:
First Name
Last Name
email
HHS ID
- Anthony Hamilton has approved the request for the new user
​​- You have access to AWS VPN


- git clone sysadmin_tools
- cd sysadmin_tools/ldap_admin
- ./ldap_add_user
- continue through the prompts
- For the group number question, select 111 as the default (or any other if you know which group to add the user)

==================================================================
Misc notes
==================================================================

common name ====> First name
surname =====> Last name
display name ====> UID (first.last)
Email ====> you guessed it

item.title: new hhs vpn acct creation
item.description:
3Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS VPN Account Creation 

Revision History:
    2015-05-07 21:42:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)
- This applies to the new HHS Environment.

Links:
None noted.


Prerequisites
You have access to the new HHS VPN
Anthony Hamilton has approved the request. (I believe this is a prereq)

2 Steps:
- add the user to the init.pp file in puppet
- Run puppet on OpenVPN

Puppet Work
1) ssh into puppetmaster.svcs.hhs.local
2) Edit /etc/puppetlabs/puppet/hhs_puppet_rp/environments/production/modules/profile_hhs_vpn/manifests/init.pp
3) Add the user based on either admin or user (it should be clear)
4) Save/quit

OpenVPN Work
1) Log into vpn-01.svcs.hhs.local
2) Run puppet:
puppet agent -t
3) navigate to /etc/openvpn/{hhs}/download-configs
4) get the tar.gz for the user 
5) that tar.gz contains the cert, and a config
6) Send the file, but remember **treat that file securely***

Misc Notes:
If you’re sending the attachment via HHS, there’s a chance the mail server will strip the attachment. In recent conversations, Robert and Arash have requested that the certs be uploaded to 10.153.61.215 in the stopbullying’s home directory (/appdata/stopbullying). Update to the delivery of the VPN cert - 



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: old hhs revoke vpn certificate
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Old HHS VPN revoke a client certificate

Revision History:
    2015-08-05 21:42:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)
- This applies to the new HHS Environment.

Links:
None noted.


Prerequisites
You have access to the old VPN server (pem key required)
a ticket exists for this request.

TLDR: 
2 Steps:
- run the revoke-full command
- Run puppet


Full steps (not a lot longer than the TLDR):
— make note of your user (example: pcatacora)
 ssh into OpenVPN
- cd /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa
- Run this command:
./revoke-full pcatacora
- If the .crt, .cer, and/or .key files remain in /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/keys, you can safely remove this.

if you get an error trying to recreate a cert that you have revoked (as a result of the cert possibly erring during creation, follow these steps:
- Make a note of the user account (ex: pcatacora)
- remove pcatacora.crt, pcatacora.cer, pctacora.key (or move them to the /tmp directory)
- edit index.txt file and remove any line with pcatacora in its name.
- run the make_vpn_certs.sh script again

Misc Notes:
If you’re sending the attachment via HHS, there’s a chance the mail server will strip the attachment. In recent conversations, Robert and Arash have requested that the certs be uploaded to 10.153.61.215 in the stopbullying’s home directory (/appdata/stopbullying…i think).



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: search
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: search.hhs.gov Sensu monitoring/alerting/responding

Revision History:
    2015-06-26 Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Applies to:
- HHS environment


Links:
 - http://sensu-01.svcs.hhs.local:3000
 - http://search.hhs.gov
 - http://128.231.54.167
 - http://128.231.54.166
 - http://165.112.1.54

Background
NIH hosts 3 GSA servers that serve search.hhs.gov. These servers are relatively old and somewhat unreliable but still being used. hhs-origin-ws-01/-2 are running haproxy in the HHS environment, and handle the appropriate traffic from hhs.gov. They point to the following 3 servers:

http://128.231.54.167 - Primary
http://128.231.54.166 - Backup
http://165.112.1.54 - Coop

The only need for concern is when there are active alerts for all 3 servers. If not, then we can safely assume that search.hhs.gov is not entirely down. 


Responding to the alert
There is no need to respond to the alert. As requested, we have created additional recipients on the notification list. So when you receive an alert, they will be notified as well. If the alert persists, the usual course of action is that Alex (from HHS) will go onsite to NIH and reboot the server.

You may, however, want to silence the alert. 

Possible temporary fixes:
Again, I am still of the impression that no action is necessary, since the task should be to fix the root cause, and not apply bandaids. After all, this has been an ongoing issue since November 2015. But if you are inclined…
- if curl from hhs-origin-03 succeeds, you can swap the search-proxy ELB from origin-01 & origin-02 instances with origin-03.

Unfortunately the above was done one weekend only to have NIH block that IP a few hours later, so the following suggestion has been made:
- if curl from origin-01, -02, AND -03 fail, then Bishal will probably already be talking about spinning up a new origin server. Meanwhile, Aquilent, HHS, and NIH will be talking about how to prevent this in the future. By the time origin-04 is spun up and configured and your fix is in place, they’ll probably have their firewall rules close to being updated, and then you can revert your changes.


Sensu Check
The Sensu check is /etc/sensu/conf.d/checks/check_http.json. You can test the status of any URL using the below command as an example:
/etc/sensu/conf.d/checks# /opt/sensu/embedded/bin/ruby /etc/sensu/plugins/check-http.rb --url http://128.231.54.167 -r


Outstanding tasks:
- haproxy puppet module/manifest

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: Prometheus Scripts
item.description:
$ cat ~/bin/SiteList.sh
#!/bin/bash

if [ $# == 1 ] ; then
  PROMINSTANCE=${1}
else
  PROMINSTANCE="noc"
fi

case ${PROMINSTANCE} in
  hhs )
    SITEURL="http://prometheus.svcs.hhs.local:9090"
    ;;
  noc )
    SITEURL="https://monitor.ctacdev.com/prometheus"
    ;;
  * )
    echo "Unknown Instance"
    exit 1
esac

curl -sk "${SITEURL}/api/v1/query?query=probe_success" | jq -r '.data.result[].metric | [.instance] | @tsv'

$ cat ~/bin/SiteFailList.sh
#!/bin/bash

if [ $# == 1 ] ; then
  PROMINSTANCE=${1}
else
  PROMINSTANCE="noc"
fi

case ${PROMINSTANCE} in
  hhs )
    SITEURL="http://prometheus.svcs.hhs.local:9090"
    ;;
  noc )
    SITEURL="https://monitor.ctacdev.com/prometheus"
    ;;
  * )
    echo "Unknown Instance"
    exit 1
esac

TempFile="/tmp/faillist"

QUERY=`echo 'up == 0' | jq -sRr @uri`
curl -sk "${SITEURL}/api/v1/query?query=${QUERY}" | jq -r '.data.result[].metric | [.environment,.instance] | @tsv' | sed -e 's/^/instance\t/' > ${TempFile}

DROPLIST="-e fwupd-refresh.service -e cloud-final.service"
QUERY=`echo 'node_systemd_unit_state{state="failed"} == 1' | jq -sRr @uri`
curl -sk "${SITEURL}/api/v1/query?query=${QUERY}" | jq -r '.data.result[].metric | [.environment,.instance,.name] | @tsv' | grep -v ${DROPLIST} | sed -e 's/^/service\t/' >> ${TempFile}

sed -e 's/\t\t/\tNONE\t/g' -e 's/;/ /g' ${TempFile} | column -t
